Discover what you’ll become among a caring community

The beginning of your great life-story begins at Adams State University, and you won’t have to discover it alone. As a student, you’ll become part of an intimate community that welcomes everyone as they are and helps each other get ahead – academically, socially and professionally.

In fact, you’ll be encouraged to aim higher than you ever thought possible by a passionate faculty, staff and alumni network. With one of the most diverse student populations in Colorado, you’ll be exposed to new ideas and different perspectives by your fellow grizzlies.
My professors ask about my future goals and help as much as possible. All my professors are great mentors who continue to lead me in the right direction.
Experience Adams and the San Luis Valley. Register to visit campus and learn why Adams’ welcoming community is right for you.

The College Assistance Migrant Program (CAMP) at Adams State University is a program federally funded by the U.S. Department of Education, Office of Migrant Education.

The program’s goal is to provide academic, social and financial support services to migrant and seasonal farmworkers or their dependents; to assist them in the successful completion of their first year of college; and to develop a persistence toward degree attainment.

CAMP Benefits and Services are provided to eligible students to assist in developing the necessary skills for transitioning into the Adams State University setting in multiple areas throughout your first academic year.
In addition to the potential of substantial scholarships and stipends during the first year, other support includes
How do I qualify for CAMP?
To be eligible to participate in CAMP the student or at least one parent must be a seasonal or migrant farmworker.
Students may also be eligible if they participate in a Chapter 1 Migrant Education Program, National Farmworker Jobs Program (NFJP), or High School Equivalency Program (HEP).
a high school diploma or GED
be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident
have been accepted to Adams State University

You may qualify for a scholarship to assist with tuition/housing and fees for your first year! Let us determine your eligibility and get you started on your Adams State University education. Call a CAMP recruiter at 719-587-8331

Selected CAMP San Luis Valley resident students with a “zero” EFC (Expected Family Contribution) and minimum “80” Admissions Index Score may qualify for up to $11,000 in financial support. Other selected CAMP students, including out of area students, may receive lower amounts.

Selection for CAMP is based on a review of financial, social, and academic need, interviews and other information provided. The CAMP selection committee will select participants for this program. Continued support of CAMP students is determined by the student’s ability to successfully meet CAMP requirements.

El programa de CAMP en la Universidad de Adams State en Alamosa, Colorado es un programa establecido por el gobierno federal, diseñado para estudiantes universitarios de familias migrantes o que trabajan en la agricultura temporal.

Nuestra universidad ofrece un programa intensivo durante el primer año de estudios con asistencia de becas. Ademas, nuestro programa está basado en el apoyo personal, académico, y financiero promoviendo la continuación de la educación de nuestros estudiantes.
